Articles.Content: Hi everyone. I downloaded KSP to play on my Mac but I'm having a problem. i can't seem to use the science modules like the goo, when I'm in flight and i click on it, nothing happens.
Forgive these basic questions, just want to eliminate some obvious causes: Are you playing sandbox mode? Are you right-clicking the science modules?
I'm playing on career mode and I'm on a macbook pro so there is no left/right clicking.

> 
> I'm playing on career mode and I'm on a macbook pro so there is no left/right clicking.

That's what happens. If you left-click the Goo nothing happens. You have to *right-click* it.

I also play on a Mac but i usually use another mouse, because it's hard to use the trackpad to play. In order to use the right lick on you trackpad, you can change your mouse settings or use left-click+cmd.

I hope that's the problem! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
In mouse settings you can enable right click for Apple mouse or magic mouse, its a life saver for macs

> 
> I'm playing on career mode and I'm on a macbook pro so there is no left/right clicking.

KSP heavily relies on right-clicking, so you will need to sort that out.
[http://www.wikihow.com/Right-Click-on-a-Mac](https://www.wikihow.com/Right-Click-on-a-Mac)

You might additionally need to change the throttle controls in KSP to something else, since the default Left Control/Left Shift probably interferes with Ctrl+Click.
